summaries.body: The AMC cinema chain floated the idea of letting people text in theaters, but backed off the idea within a day. Here’s what people thought of the idea. (Not much.)

display_asset.caption: Women outside a shopping mall in Riyadh last year. “Young women are irritated to no end by the religious police,” said Bernard Haykel, a professor of Near Eastern studies at Princeton.
display_asset.credit: Tomas Munita for The New York Times

summaries.body: Saudi Arabia has announced steps to rein in its feared religious police, saying members can no longer detain or pursue suspects, and should be “gentle and kind.”

display_asset.caption: The restoration of the Matrera Castle in southern Spain has drawn comparisons to a botched amateur restoration in 2012 of a nearly century-old fresco of Jesus in the county’s northeast.

summaries.body: Last month, critics mocked the restoration of the Spanish castle of Matrera as a barbarity. Now, a community of architects has honored it with a preservation prize.

display_asset.caption: Jan Böhmermann at an awards ceremony in Düsseldorf, Germany, in January. The German comedian faces a lawsuit over his lampooning of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey.
display_asset.credit: Rolf Vennenbernd/DPA, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Angela Merkel allowed Turkey to press a court case against Jan Böhmermann, a German comic who lampooned President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

display_asset.caption: Helen Clark, a former prime minister of New Zealand and a candidate for secretary general of the United Nations, fielded questions on Thursday. She is one of nine people vying for the job.

summaries.body: Over three days this week, ambassadors interviewed the nine men and women vying to be the next secretary general of the United Nations.

display_asset.caption: The Bushmaster AR-15 rifle used by Adam Lanza in the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School. A judge ruled that a lawsuit against the gun’s manufacturer can proceed.

summaries.body: A Connecticut judge ruled that a lawsuit against the manufacturer of the gun used in the Newtown massacre can proceed.

display_asset.credit: Peter DaSilva for The New York Times

summaries.body: The head of AMC Entertainment said he's open to allowing texting in some of his chain’s movie theaters. “You can’t tell a 22-year-old to turn off their cellphone,” he said.

display_asset.caption: Mike Piazza celebrated with teammates after hitting a two-run home run in the New York Mets’ first game after Sept. 11, 2001.

summaries.body: A group reached an agreement to buy a Mets jersey that Mike Piazza wore during the first game held in New York after 9/11. It will be displayed at Citi Field and two museums.
The Hong Kong-based chef behind the cheapest Michelin-starred restaurant in the world is opening a dim sum parlor in New York City.
The Czech Republic, which has long suffered from an identity crisis, is now seeking a snappier name. Its foreign minister has proposed renaming the country Czechia.

display_asset.caption: The campus of Idaho State University in Pocatello.
display_asset.credit: Kim Raff for The New York Times

summaries.body: Federal and local officials are investigating burglaries and hate literature that appear to be targeting Muslim students at Idaho State University in Pocatello.

display_asset.caption: A swarm of crabs found off the Pacific coast of Panama.
display_asset.credit: Jesus G. Pineda/Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution

summaries.body: Marine biologists uncovered a deep-sea swarm of crabs marching along like a zombie horde at the Hannibal Bank Seamount, off the coast of Panama.

display_asset.caption: Jason Sudeikis and Jessica Biel in “The Devil and the Deep Blue Sea.” Ms. Biel is also a producer on the film.

summaries.body: Jason Sudeikis and Jessica Biel discussed their film "The Devil and the Deep Blue Sea," premiering Thursday night at the Tribeca Film Festival.

display_asset.caption: A movie executive is open to the idea of text-friendly theaters.
display_asset.credit: Peter DaSilva for The New York Times

summaries.body: The chief executive of AMC Entertainment floated the idea of letting people text in movie theaters. People on social media did not approve.

display_asset.caption: Muslim men at the Baitul Futuh Mosque in London. A new poll revealed views among Britain’s largest religious minority that differed from the greater population’s.

summaries.body: A new poll of British Muslims revealed attitudes on homosexuality and terrorism sharply out of step with public opinion, but set off a debate about survey reliability.
A video shows a chimpanzee named Chacha desperately trying to avoid capture by climbing an electric pole after he fled from a zoo in Japan.

display_asset.caption: Police officers at the site of the shooting of a Houston deputy constable late Wednesday.

summaries.body: A man shot and wounded a deputy constable during a traffic stop in Houston late Wednesday in what the authorities described as an ambush-style attack.

display_asset.caption: A senior citizen learned to use a Facebook account during a class at a branch of the New York Public Library in 2012. Not pictured: the author’s dad.

summaries.body: What do older Americans do on Facebook? The same things as their younger counterparts: Bond with old friends, develop new relationships and keep tabs on loved ones.

display_asset.caption: Opponents of the bill protested outside the Mississippi governor’s mansion last week in Jackson, the capital.

summaries.body: A new law in Mississippi has ignited fierce opposition over its provisions to allow people with religious objections to deny certain services to gay couples.

display_asset.caption: A man walking past a display at a museum in Hong Kong dedicated to remembering the June 1989 crackdown on the Tiananmen Square protests in Beijing.

summaries.body: The world's only museum dedicated to China's 1989 Tiananmen protest movement is expected to close this year in Hong Kong.

display_asset.caption: From left, Pedro Almodóvar, director of “Julieta”; Xavier Dolan, director of “It’s Only the End of the World”; and Sean Penn, director of “The Last Face.”
display_asset.credit: From left, Ian Langsdon/European Pressphoto Agency; Guillaume Horcajuelo/European Pressphoto Agency; Ian Langsdon/European Pressphoto Agency

summaries.body: Movies by Pedro Almodóvar, Xavier Dolan and Sean Penn will compete for the Palme d’Or at this year’s Cannes Film Festival in May.

display_asset.credit: Bryan Denton for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Senate voted to ban the import of virtually all ancient artifacts from Syria to discourage looting and trafficking.

display_asset.credit: Joel Philippsen/The Republic, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A man was sentenced to five years in jail for trying to smuggle 51 live turtles from Michigan to Canada inside of his pants.

display_asset.credit: Corey Lowenstein/Raleigh News & Observer, via Getty Images

summaries.body: In response to a law limiting gay and transgender rights, two brewers in North Carolina are cooking up a new beer, Don't Be Mean to People: A Golden Rule Saison.

display_asset.caption: President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine, left, at a ceremony in January that honored people killed in the 1918 Battle of Kiev. Mr. Poroshenko was impersonated in a conference call with The New York Times editorial board this week.

summaries.body: A man impersonating Ukraine's president called The New York Times. When audio was posted on YouTube, the journalists found themselves in an apparent propaganda war.

display_asset.caption: Harvard has a long tradition of all-male social clubs. The clubs broke official ties with Harvard after it required them to admit women.
display_asset.credit: Charlie Mahoney for The New York Times

summaries.body: Members of the oldest all-male social club at Harvard rejected calls to admit women, saying that doing so would increase the chances of sexual misconduct.

display_asset.caption: Students visited the Richard Rodgers Theater, where a dozen groups of them rapped and sang their responses to the “Hamilton” creator, Lin-Manuel Miranda, before watching a matinee of the show.

summaries.body: New York City students saw "Hamilton" and rapped for Lin-Manuel Miranda, the Broadway show's creator, as part of a program sponsored by the Rockefeller Foundation.

display_asset.caption: Matthew Keys, right, with his lawyer, Jason Leiderman, in Sacramento in 2013.

summaries.body: A California journalist, Matthew Keys, was sentenced to two years in federal prison for helping the group Anonymous hack The Los Angeles Times website in 2010.

display_asset.caption: Sonar imaging found the 30-foot movie prop, which sank in 1969.

summaries.body: An underwater drone has found the Loch Ness Monster. Well, it found a model of Nessie that sank during the making of “The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes" in 1969.
A Russian plane flew "dangerously close" to an American ship and a Polish aircraft, the White House said, citing “repeated incidents” over the past year.
